name: 朴維鎮
objective: This course introduces students to the process of data science, covering problem formulation, data acquisition, modeling and analysis, and presentation and integration into action. Students will learn useful skills as well as basic statistical methods by completing several hands-on problems focused on real-world data. This course starts with a brief introduction to multivariate data analysis and data summarization including visualization. Then it extends to focus on using data to develop predictive capabilities using supervised and unsupervised machine learning models (regression, classification, clustering, PCA, etc.).
schedule:
Week 1	Data summarization and visualization
Week 2-4	Multivariate normal distribution
Week 5-6	Principal component analysis
Week 7-8	Naïve Bayes, Neural networks
Week 9	Exam or assignment
Week 10-14	Supervised learning (Regression, Classification, Decision tree, kNN, SVM, Ensemble method – Bagging, RF, Boosting)
Week 15-17	Unsupervised learning (Clustering, k-means)
Week 18	Exam or assignment
scorePolicy:
1. Final Exam or Project: 40 %
2. Assignment: 50 %
3. Attendance: 10 %
materials:
Textbook: ‘Applied Multivariate Statistical Analysis’ written by Richard A. Johnson and Dean W. Wichern.
Supplementary references: ‘Introduction to Machine Learning with Python: A Guide for Data Scientists’ written by Andreas C. Müller and Sarah Guido
